DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether fully covered or partially covered metal stents are more favorable in incurable malignant stenosis of the esophagus or cardia. Primary outcome will be the occurence of recurrent dysphagia which is defined as dysphagia due to a stent or tumour related cause in a 6-month follow-up
DOC.brief_title: Fully Covered or Partially Covered Stents in Malignant Esophageal Strictures
DOC.criteria: Malignant stricture of the esophagus or cardia No curative treatment options available Dysphagia grade of at least 2 (i.e. swallow semisolid foods or less) Informed consent Age â‰¥ 18 years Previous treatment with selfexpandable metal stent for same condition Evidence of tumor within 2 cm of the upper esophageal sphincter. Presence of an esophagotracheal or bronchial fistula or both. Not able to undergo upper endoscopy
